member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.AppendTokenTables
member.summary: Writes the contents of the string and object token tables into the stream. Also write the starting offset into the first 4 bytes of the stream. Notes: Called automatically by ToArray(). Can be used to ensure that the complete graph is written before using an alternate technique of extracting a Byte[] such as using compression on the underlying stream.
member.returns: The length of the string and object tables.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.ToArray
member.summary:
Returns a byte[] containing all of the serialized data.
The current implementation has the data in 3 sections: 1) A 4 byte Int32 giving the offset to the 3rd section. 2) The main serialized data. 3) The serialized string tokenization lists and object tokenization lists.
Only call this method once all of the data has been serialized.
This method appends all of the tokenized data (string and object) to the end of the stream and ensures that the first four bytes reflect the offset of the tokenized data so that it can be deserialized first. This is the reason for requiring a rewindable stream.
Future implementations may also allow the serialized data to be accessed via 2 byte[] arrays. This would remove the requirement for a rewindable stream opening the possibility of streaming the serialized data directly over the network allowing simultaneous of partially simultaneous deserialization.
member.returns: A byte[] containing all serialized data.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.ToStream
member.summary: Returns a Stream containing all of the serialized data.
member.returns: Stream containing all serialized data

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.WriteBytesDirect(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes a byte[] directly into the stream. The size of the array is not stored so only use this method when the number of bytes will be known at deserialization time.
A null value will throw an exception
member.param: The byte[] to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.WriteStringDirect(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a non-null string directly to the stream without tokenization.
member.param: The string to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.WriteTokenizedObject(System.Object)
member.summary:
Writes a token (an Int32 taking 1 to 4 bytes) into the stream that represents the object instance. The same token will always be used for the same object instance.
The object will be serialized once and recreated at deserialization time. Calls to SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject() will retrieve the same object instance.
member.param: The object to tokenize. Must not be null and must not be a string.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.WriteTokenizedObject(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Writes a token (an Int32 taking 1 to 4 bytes) into the stream that represents the object instance. The same token will always be used for the same object instance.
When recreateFromType is set to true, the object's Type will be stored and the object recreated using Activator.GetInstance with a parameterless contructor. This is useful for stateless, factory-type classes.
When recreateFromType is set to false, the object will be serialized once and recreated at deserialization time.
Calls to SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject() will retrieve the same object instance.
member.param: The object to tokenize. Must not be null and must not be a string.
true if the object can be recreated using a parameterless constructor; false if the object should be serialized as-is

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.encodeTimeSpan(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes a TimeSpan into the fewest number of bytes. Has been separated from the WriteOptimized(TimeSpan) method so that WriteOptimized(DateTime) can also use this for .NET 2.0 DateTimeKind information. By taking advantage of the fact that a DateTime's TimeOfDay portion will never use the IsNegative and HasDays flags, we can use these 2 bits to store the DateTimeKind and, since DateTimeKind is unlikely to be set without a Time, we need no additional bytes to support a .NET 2.0 DateTime.
member.param: The TimeSpan to store.
True if the TimeSpan is the TimeOfDay from a DateTime; False if a real TimeSpan.
The intial data for the BitVector32 - contains DateTimeKind or 0

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.checkOptimizable(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether an optimization condition has been met and throw an exception if not.
This method has been made conditional on THROW_IF_NOT_OPTIMIZABLE being set at compile time. By default, this is set if DEBUG is set but could be set explicitly if exceptions are required and the evaluation overhead is acceptable. If not set, then this method and all references to it are removed at compile time.
Leave at the default for optimum usage.
member.param: An expression evaluating to true if the optimization condition is met, false otherwise.
The message to include in the exception should the optimization condition not be met.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedSigned32BitValue(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Stores a 32-bit signed value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(Int32) for details of the values that are optimizable.
member.param: The Int32 value to encode.

The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(Int64) for details of the values that are optimizable.
member.param: The Int64 value to encode.

The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.

The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.writeObjectArray(System.Object[])
member.summary:
Writes the values in the non-null object[] into the stream.
Sequences of null values and sequences of DBNull.Values are stored with a flag and optimized count. Other values are stored using WriteObject().
This routine is called by the Write(object[]), WriteOptimized(object[]) and Write(object[], object[])) methods.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.writeTypeCode(SuperOffice.IO.SerializedType)
member.summary:
Stores the specified SerializedType code into the stream.
By using a centralized method, it is possible to collect statistics for the type of data being stored in DEBUG mode.
Use the DumpTypeUsage() method to show a list of used SerializedTypes and the number of times each has been used. This method and the collection code will be optimized out when compiling in Release mode.
member.param: The SerializedType to store.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.writeTypedArray(System.Array,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal implementation to write a non-null typed array into the stream.
member.remarks:
Checks first to see if the element type is a primitive type and calls the correct routine if so. Otherwise determines the best, optimized method to store the array contents.
An array of object elements never stores its type.
member.param: The non-null typed array to store.
True if the type should be stored; false otherwise

member.summary: Checks whether instances of a Type can be created.
member.remarks: A Value Type only needs to implement IOwnedDataSerializable. A Reference Type needs to implement IOwnedDataSerializableAndRecreatable and provide a default constructor.

member.returns: true if the Type is recreatable; false otherwise.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.TypeSurrogates
member.summary: Holds a list of optional IFastSerializationTypeSurrogate instances which SerializationWriter and SerializationReader will use to serialize objects not directly supported. It is important to use the same list on both client and server ends to ensure that the same surrogated-types are supported.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.OptimizeForSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets a boolean flag to indicate whether to optimize for size (default) by storing data as packed bits or sections where possible. Setting this value to false will turn off this optimization and store data directly which increases the speed. Note: This only affects optimization of data passed to the WriteObject method and direct calls to the WriteOptimized methods will always pack data into the smallest space where possible.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.PreserveDecimalScale
member.summary: Gets or Sets a boolean flag to indicate whether to preserve the scale within a Decimal value when it would have no effect on the represented value. Note: a 2m value and a 2.00m value represent the same value but internally they are stored differently - the former has a value of 2 and a scale of 0 and the latter has a value of 200 and a scale of 2. The scaling factor also preserves any trailing zeroes in a Decimal number. Trailing zeroes do not affect the value of a Decimal number in arithmetic or comparison operations. However, trailing zeroes can be revealed by the ToString method if an appropriate format string is applied. From a serialization point of view, the former will take 2 bytes whereas the latter would take 4 bytes, therefore it is preferable to not save the scale where it doesn't affect the represented value.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.SingletonTypeWrapper
member.summary: Private class used to wrap an object that is to be tokenized, and recreated at deserialization by its type.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationWriter.UniqueStringList
member.summary:
Provides a faster way to store string tokens both maintaining the order that they were added and providing a fast lookup.
Based on code developed by ewbi at http://ewbi.blogs.com/develops/2006/10/uniquestringlis.html

member.name: T:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationReader
member.summary:
A SerializationReader instance is used to read stored values and objects from a byte array.
Once an instance is created, use the various methods to read the required data. The data read MUST be exactly the same type and in the same order as it was written.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationReader.decodeTimeSpan(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Returns a TimeSpan decoded from packed data. This routine is called from ReadOptimizedDateTime() and ReadOptimizedTimeSpan().
This routine uses a parameter to allow ReadOptimizedDateTime() to 'peek' at the next byte and extract the DateTimeKind from bits one and two (IsNegative and HasDays) which are never set for a Time portion of a DateTime.
member.param: The first of two always-present bytes.
member.returns: A decoded TimeSpan

member.name: P:SuperOffice.IO.SerializationReader.BytesRemaining
member.summary:
Returns the number of bytes or serialized remaining to be processed. Useful for checking that deserialization is complete.
Warning: Retrieving the Position in certain stream types can be expensive, e.g. a FileStream, so use sparingly unless known to be a MemoryStream.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EOwnershipIndex.OtherToExternal

member.name: T:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight
member.summary: Table right is a combination of bits representing permissions on a row. Logical bitwise operations has to be performed using the , , and .
member.remarks:
Delete and Insert permissions are straight forward, represented with one bit each. Read and Update permissions are more complex as they have a three-state represented with two bits. The rules for both of them are identical and they are explained using Read as an example:
Read means full read access, FilteredRead means that some of the fields can be read, but not all. The combination of these two bits (i.e. Read | FilteredRead) is an illegal state. As Read is a Right with higher access than FilteredRead, the bitwise arithmetic becomes somewhat complex: Read & Read -> Read, Read & FilteredRead -> FilteredRead, FilteredRead & FilteredRead -> FilteredRead, Read | Read -> Read, Read | FilteredRead -> Read and FilteredRead | FilteredRead -> FilteredRead.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.None
member.summary: The row should be hidden from the user.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.Select
member.summary: The user is allowed to see the row.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.Update
member.summary: The user is allowed to modify the values in this row. Applies to rows with id > 0. Row with id = 0 needs insert rights instead.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.Insert
member.summary: The user is allowed to add new rows to the table. Implies update rights on a row with id = 0.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.Delete
member.summary: The user is allowed to delete this row.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.Filtering
member.summary: A flag used to indicate that some fields may be hidden. The user has no Select access, but he will have Filtering. Used on rows where the visiblity flag may affect what the user can see (e.g.: private appointments).

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.RestrictedUpdate
member.summary: A hint flag used to indicate that some fields may not be updateable, even though the user has update access to the row. Used on rows where some fields are locked down by business rules or integrity constraints. (e.g.: the database owner contact.name field is read-only. An invitation's contact id is read-only)

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.Unused1
member.summary: Unused value only present for serializatrion purposes

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.Uninitialized
member.summary: Magic value to indicate not

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.FULL
member.summary: Select, Update, Insert, Delete - no restrictions

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.WRITE
member.summary: Update/RestrictedUpdate or Insert

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.URU
member.summary: Update or RestrictedUpdate

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.UDR
member.summary: Select, Update, Delete

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.UR
member.summary: Select or Update

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.URI
member.summary: Select, Update, Insert

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.R
member.summary: Select only

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.RI
member.summary: Select and Insert (Anonymous)

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.RF
member.summary: Select or Filter

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.F
member.summary: just Filtering

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.ETableRight.FI
member.summary: Filtering and Insert (Anonymous)

member.name: T:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight
member.summary: Access levels to a single field. Read and/or write.
member.remarks:
Read and write access are bitflags, so you could use just the write-access without the equivalent read-access.
This would be a silly thing to do.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight.None
member.summary: Hidden from user.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight.Read
member.summary: Read-only right

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight.Write
member.summary: Write-only (not terribly useful)

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight.Update
member.summary: Read + Write rights combined

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight.UIHintMandatory
member.summary: Field must be filled out (not blank)

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight.UIHintReadOnly
member.summary: Field can only be read, not updated, in the user interface.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight.FULL
member.summary: All possible rights (same as Update = Read + Write)

member.name: F:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.EFieldRight.UIHints

member.name: T:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.GenericRight
member.summary: Base class for , and . Provides a read-only reason field. Sub-classes define one or more permissions that the right can allow. For example: FieldRight defines Read+Write+Mandatory rights on a field.
member.remarks: Get fresh rights from the , where they are made to order. Rights are read-only, static objects. You cannot modify a field-right or table right object. This is because a field-right object may be a shared instance, so modifying it will modify all fields, not just one.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.GenericRight.HasAll
member.summary: Returns true if the right has all the permissions implied by the right.
member.remarks: For a this implies that the right is active. For a this implies that the field has Read+Write permissions.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.GenericRight.HasNone
member.summary: Returns true if the right has none of the permissions implied by the right.
member.remarks: For a this means that the right is not active. For a this means that the field is hidden (no read+no write permission)

member.summary: Should the reason be ignored?

member.name: P:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.GenericRight.Reason
member.summary: Contains a string that explains why the right is not available. The reason is blank if HasAll is true.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FunctionRight
member.summary: Represents a Function Right together with an description of the function. Function rights typically represent abilities like "can admin users" or "can create private appointments".
member.remarks:
Function rights have a descriptive name, a description, and a key. For example: key = "admin-all", name="General Administrator", description="Has access to all maintenance functions."
Usually obtained from the SuperOffice.CRM.Security.RightsFactory rather than created directly by the client.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Threading.ThreadPerOperationBase`2
member.summary: This class provides a thread-per-operation execution model, where (in principle) a new thread is spawned and immediately starts executing for each asynchronous operation. The number of threads is limited by configuration information, and callers will block once the limit is reached.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Threading.ThreadPerOperationBase`2.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor, only called from derived classes

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Threading.ThreadPerOperationBase`2.ScheduleNewWork
member.summary: Scheduling strategy method, provides the basic "queue and process in FIFO order" strategy
member.remarks: Thread number limiting is a global responsibility, handled by the class. It will block if no thread slots are available.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Threading.ThreadPerOperationBase`2.ThreadDelegate(SuperOffice.Threading.AsyncContext,System.Object)
member.summary: The delegate routine passed to the for the async call
member.remarks: This method is a template method that calls OnOperation to do the actual work, then executes any generated insert/update queries before the thread is allowed to die.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Threading.AsyncChunkedProcessedQueue`3
member.summary: Base class for queue or FIFO that is processed in chunks.
member.remarks: As items are added to the queue it is either passed to an exsisting for processing or it is passed to a new one. The processes queued items until the queue is emptied and then dies. If there are no current working on the queue, a new one is created.
member.typeparam: The type that is in the queue
The processor that processes a chunk of the queue.
Handler holding the thread and is using the processor for processing a chunk of the queue.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Security.Cryptography.Symmetric
member.summary: Utility class for performing simple symmetric encryption and decryption based upon values in the .

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.Cryptography.Symmetric.Encrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts the string and return it as a Base64 encoded encrypted string.
member.param: Text to encrypt.
member.returns: Encrypted Base64 encoded string
member.remarks:
The text is encrypted through these steps:
Create signature.Append a secret to the text and generate a hash using SHA256.
Encrypt signature and textusing a Rijndael symmetric algorithm.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.Cryptography.Symmetric.EncryptBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypts the byte array (e.g. byte[]) and return it as a Base64 encoded encrypted string.
member.param: byte array (e.g. byte[]) to encrypt.
member.returns: Encrypted Base64 encoded string
member.remarks:
The byte array (e.g. byte[]) is encrypted through these steps:
Create signature.Append a secret to the byte array (e.g. byte[]) and generate a hash using SHA256.
Encrypt signature and byte array (e.g. byte[])using a Rijndael symmetric algorithm.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.Cryptography.Symmetric.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts the Base64 encoded string and return it as a clear-text string.
member.param: Base64 encoded encrypted string.
member.returns: Decrypted string
member.remarks:
The encrypted text is decrypted and validated through these steps
Decrypt signature and textusing a Rijndael symmetric algorithm.
Create signature.Append a secret to the text and generate a hash using SHA256.
Validate the signatureby comparing the decrypted signature to the signature created from the text.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.Cryptography.Symmetric.DecryptBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts the Base64 encoded string and return it as a byte array (e.g. byte[]).
member.param: Base64 encoded encrypted string.
member.returns: Decrypted byte array (e.g. byte[]).
member.remarks:
The encrypted byte array (e.g. byte[]) is decrypted and validated through these steps
Decrypt signature and byte array (e.g. byte[])using a Rijndael symmetric algorithm.
Create signature.Append a secret to the byte array (e.g. byte[]) and generate a hash using SHA256.
Validate the signatureby comparing the decrypted signature to the signature created from the byte array (e.g. byte[]).

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Factory.ICustomFactory
member.summary: This interface is used to declare a CustomFactory for the and will be used by the method.
member.remarks:
Interface for implementing custom Factories.
When to use. Only to be used by .
When to implement.
After thinking twice! Implement when a custom behaviour for creating a type is needed AND the decision for doing so must be made at RUN-TIME. It is strongly recommended that the "from-to" mechanisms in the configuration file be considered before implementing a custom factory! There needs to be a reference to the Factory within the configuration section used by the .
Objects implementing this interface must be declared with the attribute.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Factory.ICustomFactory.Create(System.Type,System.Type[],System.Object[])

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Util.VisitorPatternHelper`1
member.summary: Helper class for performing a Visitor-type invocation of methods on some node structure
member.remarks:
See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visitor_pattern for a description of the Visitor pattern. Visitor is a fairly abstract pattern and will usually require some thought to follow through.
The class performs the dispatching/invocation of visitor methods, so the client class only needs to provide methods that handle the required types of nodes in the visited structure.
Generally the client class will provide a class instance that contains one or more Visit methods. It will then call the or method, giving the root node of some structure to be visited as the input parameter(s).
The VisitorPatternHelper will reflect on the client class and try to find a method whose signature matches the input. If it finds one, it will forward the call to this method, which may recursively call one of the InvokeXXXVisitor methods in turn.
member.typeparam: Return type for the visit methods

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Util.VisitorPatternHelper`1.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Initialize the visitor helper with a method prefix and a target class
member.param: The prefix that all visitation methods must be named with
The class that contains the visitation methods

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Util.VisitorPatternHelper`1.BuildHelper
member.summary: Builds a collection of methods for the target class, with the given method name prefix and return value type.
member.returns: A collection of methods for the current type (e.g. subclass) of this object. This is a Hashtable taking the name of the arguments types as the key, and the value is an instance of a MethodInfo object representing the ToSql method.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Util.VisitorPatternHelper`1.InvokeStrictVisitor(System.Object[])
member.summary: Invoke the visitor, by finding and calling the method in the target class that has a signature matching the visitorArguments. If no such method is found, an exception is thrown.
member.param: Arguments to the method to be called
member.returns: Return value from the visitation method
member.exception: Thrown if the target class (given to the constructor) does not contain a method with the given name prefix and parameter signature corresponding to the current set of parameters (visitorArguments)

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Util.VisitorPatternHelper`1.InvokeTolerantVisitor(System.Object[])
member.summary: Invoke the visitor, by finding and calling the method in the target class that has a signature matching the visitorArguments. If no such method is found, no call is made and default(ReturnType) is returned (no exception thrown).
member.param: Arguments to the method to be called
member.returns: Return value from the visitation method

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Util.VisitorPatternHelper`1.InvokeVisitor(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: InvokeVisitor checks the in-parameters type against the already existing method dictionary. When the key is found in the array, the key's object method is called.
member.param: arguments as passed to the method. The arguments' type needs to be an exact match of the type implemented in the appropriate target method.
member.exception: There is no appropriate method to invoke.
An exception was thrown while trying to invoke the target method
member.returns: returns the ReturnType returned from the Invoked target method

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Security.SoImpersonationContext
member.summary: Utility class assisting with impersonation. Impersonation is only permitted if a system user is logged in using CRM5 username and password and the user that is impersonated is an employee or external person.

member.summary: Internal constructor called by
member.param: The principle object of the user that is being impersonated.

member.summary: Check if the currently logged in user is permitted to impersonate.
member.returns: True if the currently logged in user is permitted to impersonate.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.SoImpersonationContext.CanImpersonate(SuperOffice.Security.Principal.SoPrincipal)
member.summary: Check if the user represented by the provided principle is permitted to impersonate.
member.param: The user to check if it has the permission to impersonate
member.returns: True if the user represented by the provided principle is permitted to impersonate.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.SoImpersonationContext.Impersonate(System.String)
member.summary: Impersonate as the user with the provided user name. Only users of type System logged in with username and passwords are permitted to impersonate. Call or . Impersonation is not supported with remote mode.
member.param: Name of the user to impersonate as.
member.returns: Disposable context for the impersonation.
member.remarks:
Impersonation lives in the thread scope. Threads executed with the or
will also be executed inside the scope of the impersonated user. It is not permitted to log out using or in any other way end the current session like calling while in a impersonated state.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Security.Cryptography.SoHash
member.summary: Perform hashing of data, such as checksums, passwords etc. IMPORTANT - read Remarks for cross-dependency on the corresponding C++ code!
member.remarks:
This class will take a dbtag (which should always be the CentralDbTag, not the own tag of the current DB), a primary key and a binary buffer, and produce a hash. Currently the algorithm is SHA1.
The code must be cross-checked with c:\CRM_Client\main.seven\Source\SUP\SoHash.cpp and PRODUCE THE EXACT SAME RESULT for the same inputs. Any changes must be made to both codebases and carefully checked; hashes made by one codebase will routinely be checked by the other and they have to match.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.Cryptography.SoHash.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Default constructor taking the DbTag in the format it is in the database.
member.param: DbTag as formatted in the database.

member.summary: Default constructor taking the DbTag as a byte array.
member.param: DbTag as a byte array

member.summary: Private initialization.
member.param: DbTag as a byte array

member.summary: Create a private hash from the provided primary key and data

String to get a hash from.
member.returns: Hash as a byte array.

member.summary: Create a private hash from the provided primary key and data

Byte array to be hashed
member.returns: Hash as a byte array.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants
member.summary: Constants used in the data dictionary

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType
member.summary:
Field types as used in the data dictionary, taken from the Excel master data dictionary. Note that the constants are in some cases not unique (Double and Float both have 16), this is for historical reasons.
These constants should be used to interpret the property of the object.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.Char
member.summary: -1: Char, not a datatype we use at all in the database

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.Short
member.summary: 5: 16-bit signed integer

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.UShort
member.summary: 6: Unsigned 16-bit integer; also used for flags that express a boolean value (0, 1 allowed)

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.ShortId
member.summary: 7: 16-bit unsigned integer

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.Long
member.summary: 9: Signed 32-bit integer

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.ULong
member.summary: 10: Unsigned 32-bit integer

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.LongId
member.summary: 11: Record ID, in principle unsigned 32-bit integer, the 'int' datatype is used in NetServer

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.DateTime
member.summary: 12: DateTime, expressed as seconds since 00:00:00 january 1st, 1970

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.Date
member.summary: 13: Date, without a time component; not used in practice

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.Double
member.summary: 16: Floating-point value

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.Float
member.summary: 16: Floating-point value

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.String
member.summary: 17: String (usually max 254 significant characters)

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.LvString
member.summary: 18: Long string, typically 1023 or 2047 characters long, usually stored as a blob

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.VString
member.summary: 18: String, usually max 1023 or 2047 characters

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.Blob
member.summary: 20: Binary large object; only one such field is allowed per table in the current C++ SODBIF implementation.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.DbDateTime
member.summary: 21: Datetime, stored as such in the database (not stored as seconds since 1/1/1970!)

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Data.DictionaryConstants.ConceptualFieldType.TextBlob
member.summary: 22: Text large object

member.name: T:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.Metaphone
member.summary:
Generator function for Soundex strings, according to SuperOffice usage. This is based on Double Metaphone (c) 1998, 1999 by Lawrence Philips, further modified by SuperOffice.
The Soundex string generated here is used for duplicate searching - an exact match of Soundex implies a suspect duplicate of the originals.

member.summary: Generate the SoSoundex string for the given argument, with the default length
member.param: Input string, typically a company name, project name or something like that
member.returns: Resulting variant, with 9 significant characters (the default used in the database)

member.summary: Generate the SoSoundex string for the given argument, with an explicit length
member.param: Input string, typically a company name, project name or something like that
Desired length of compressed metaphone string (the result)
member.returns: Resulting metaphone string

member.summary: Check if the _inputString letter at position "at" is a vowel.
member.param: Position in _inputString to be checked
member.returns: true if vowel

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.Metaphone.StringAt(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[])
member.summary: Determine if the substring of _inputString specified by start and length contains any of the strings in stringsToMatch
member.param: Start position of _inputString to search. Values less than 0 are tolerated and give a 'false' result.
Length of _inputString to search

Array of strings to match. For compatibility with the original C++ code, blank match elements are allowed (the last element was blank, as an end marker of a variable-argument list). Blank match elements are ignored.
member.returns: true if the given substring of _inputString matches at least one of the string to search for

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.Metaphone.GetAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the character at the given position in _inputString
member.param: Position (index) of character
member.returns: The character

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.Metaphone.DoubleMetaphone(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary:
Computes the metaphone2 metaphone code of the _inputString, returning two alternative encodings of the contained string.
Note that this function assumes that the string contains one word or name only. If you want to index multiple words, use the Soundex call.
The returned codes are guaranteed to be max 5 chars in _length.
For example: Schmidt and Smith will map to the same anglicised soundcode, but will map to different codes using the code returned in the metaph2 parameter.
member.param: Output: anglicised metaphone code
Output: native metaphone code

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.Metaphone.AddTokenToSoundex(System.String,System.Int32@,System.String@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the metaphone for all the words in the string concatenated. The words contained in the string are encoded using the Metaphone2 algorithm and the resulting codes are concatednated together.
member.remarks:
We use the anglic pronounciation, rather than the native version because this catches some useful almost-matches (SCHMIDT and SMITH for example).
Single initials are concatenated together as a single word, so that * A.C. Nielsen == AC Nielsen != ACNielsen * I.B.M == IBM
There is no _length restriction on the returned code, although the upper bound is obviously (num-of-words)*5, since each word's metaphone code is 5 chars long.
* SuperOffice ASA = SPRFSAS * SuperOffice AS = SPRFSAS * SuperOffice GmbH = SPRFSKMP * SuperOffice Corp = SPRFSKRP
We ensure that the first three words are all represented, so two names which differ only by the fourth word should still match
member.param: Single word to be analysed
Word number counter, incremented
Metaphone value returned
Maximum length of final metaphone string

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.Metaphone.SafeSubstring(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: "Safe" variant of String.Substring, that will accept out of range values of start and length. Needed because the Metaphone implementation comes from a different kind of string object... that was more tolerant
member.param: String we want a substring of
Starting index
Length

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.Metaphone.GetSoundex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Top-level implementation method that splits the incoming string and iterates over the words. The input string is implicitly in _inputString!
member.param: Maximum length of final soundex string
member.returns: Soundex (metaphone) string for current value of _inputString

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Util.StackTracer
member.summary: Utility class for collecting stack traces - useful when you want to make debugging easier by collecting run-time data on where your classes get called from. Enabled by EnableScaffolding AND EnableStackTracing, which default to FALSE (EnableStackTracing defaults to TRUE in DEBUG builds).
member.remarks: StackTracer has been implemented in the TableInfo base class, because it can be infuriatingly hard to discover who allocated a certain ContactTableInfo or whatever when you start getting unwanted cross joins. This example is taken from the TableInfo class:

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Util.StackTracer.GetStack
member.summary: Get one level from the stack directly above the caller's level
member.returns: StackTracer object containing the trace, or null if tracing is off

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Util.StackTracer.GetStack(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get one level from the stack, skipping a number of additional levels first
member.param: Number of levels to skip, 1 means your parent etc
member.returns: StackTracer object containing the trace, or null if tracing is off

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Util.StackTracer.GetStack(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the given number of levels from the stack, skipping a number of additional levels first
member.param: Number of levels to skip, 1 means your parent etc
Number of levels to keep, will be limited to available. Specify -1 to get all.
member.returns: StackTracer object containing the trace, or null if tracing is off

member.summary: Return the current stack levels as a single string, with newlines between levels

member.name: T:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter
member.summary: This is a helper class designed to encode, parse and reformat culturally sensitive data types between an application server without culture knowledge, and a front-end with such knowledge.
member.remarks:
The problem: The application server does not know the culture of the current client. At the same time, we need to be able to include culturally sensitive data (such as a date) as part of a tooltip or other server-side generated text. Before displaying this text to the user, culturally sensitive elements need to be parsed and reformatted to the correct culture.
The methods in this class take care of both sides of this process. The Encode methods, such as , take a native data type as input and return a string that contains both a specification of what it is (a date) and the value formatted in the invariant culture.
The method will take such a formatted element, and by calling on the proper LocalFormat method (such as , return it in its correct form according to the current culture settings for the thread.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter.EncodeDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Encode a date, without a time part
member.param: DateTime whose date component is to be encoded
member.returns: Encoded date

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter.EncodeDate(System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encode a date, without a time part. Optionally skip encoding and return an empty string instead.
member.param: DateTime whose date component is to be encoded

If true, the input parameter is encoded to string. If false, an empty string is returned instead. This parameter is implemented to streamline coding of optimized field population in the archive providers, where a mode switch may eliminate the need for string-encoded display values.
member.returns: Encoded date

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter.EncodeDouble(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encode a double (decimal value), with the given number of decimals. Note that the full precision is included here, but rounded to the given number of decimals on (re)localization. Also note that currency amounts should use the EncodeMoney method, if the cultural settings for money are to be taken into account (though the currency symbol is NOT used in localization, because we may be displaying non-native currencies, saying $ when it's actually or NOK is silly).
member.param: Value to be encoded
Final desired number of decimals
member.returns: Encoded value

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter.MapSuperOfficeLanguageToCulture(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a SuperOffice language code ("SW") to a neutral .net culture name ("sv")
member.remarks:
If unable to determine a mapping, the default is US (English).
See also MSDN on culture codes.
member.param: SuperOffice language code. (US, NO, SW, DA, FI, FR, GE, IT, NL, SP, PL, RU, CN, CZ)
member.returns: .net neutral Culture name, or empty string (invariant culture) if no mapping found

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter.MapCultureToSuperOfficeLanguage(System.String)
member.summary: Converts .net Culture name ("sv-SE") to SuperOffice language code ("SW").
member.remarks:
Converting to a SuperOffice language code twice is harmless.
If unable to determine a mapping, the default is US (English).
See also MSDN on culture codes.
member.param: Either a culture name or a SuperOffice language code.
member.returns: A SuperOffice language code. (US, NO, SW, DA, FI, FR, GE, IT, NL, SP, PL, RU, CN, CZ)

member.name: M:SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter.ParseMultiLanguageString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns the string part of the specified culture from the multi language string These strings are typically used in SuperOffice list and description data
String example from PrefDesc table: US:"Location and size";GE:"Position und Gre";NO:"Posisjon og strrelse"
member.remarks: This version will also accept strings that have non-multilanguage text before and after the multilanguage block, and even multiple multilanguage blocks (provided there is at least one non-conforming character between them), isolating them and parsing each one separately. Non-conforming text is kept in place in the output.
member.param: The multilanguage string to parse
The cultureName, typically en-US, nb-NO, but also US, NO is accepted
member.returns: Culture specific string part, or original string if there is a problem

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Security.Principal.ISoContextProvider
member.summary: Interface that needs to be implemented by plug-ins handling the internal NetServer context. Plug-ins implemented with this interface needs to be mareked with the attribute.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.Principal.ISoContextProvider.SetCurrentContext(SuperOffice.Security.Principal.SoContextContainer)
member.summary: This method is called every time the current context needs to be stored.
member.param: Current context
member.remarks:
This method will be called when a user authenticates or continues a session. It will be called with a NULL value when a user closes or suspends his session.
This method might be called from any thread. This means that worker threads will call it in addition to threads held by the application (i.e. IIS).
Implementations can call the to check if the thread has been executed by the . This will be the case for all worker threads initiated automatically within NetServer.
It is safe to serialize and de-serialize the value of the context.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Security.Principal.ISoContextProvider.GetCurrenContext
member.summary: This method will be called every time the current context is required by anybody in NetServer
member.returns: Current principal as required by NetServer.
member.remarks:
This method might be called from any thread. This means that worker threads will call it in addition to threads held by the application (i.e. IIS).
Implementations can call the to check if the thread has been executed by the . This will be the case for all worker threads initiated automatically within NetServer.

The Create method tries to locate a type to create using the following order:
with high priority
The implementation must be marked with the and implement the interface . The property must be set to High.
with high priority
The implementation must be marked with the and implement the interface . The property must be set to High. There also needs to pe a presence of the Factory in the configuration.
Custom type through configuration
A custom type from the configuration is used, given that there is a constructor supporting the argument types provided.
with normal priority
The implementation must be marked with the and implement the interface . The property must be set to Normal. There also needs to pe a presence of the Factory in the configuration.
with normal priority
The implementation must be marked with the and implement the interface . The property must be set to Normal.
with low priority
The implementation must be marked with the and implement the interface . The property must be set to Low. There also needs to pe a presence of the Factory in the configuration.
with low priority
The implementation must be marked with the and implement the interface . The property must be set to Low.
Using Type directly
The type is used, given that there is a constructor supporting the argument types provided.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile
member.summary: Utility class used to access the SuperOffice entry in the Config file.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile._ourConfigFile
member.summary: Configuration object that points to a custom .config file. If this is null, then the default config file hierarchy (as provided by the ConfigurationManager) will be used.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.AddOverride(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set an override for a Config file value. All such overrides should be made before the first call to SoSession.Authenticate, as later calls may not be honoured (no retroactive effects!).
member.param: Path of config item, such as 'SuperOffice/Data/Database'
Name of value to be overridden, such as 'Server'
Value to substitute over the config file value, such as 'myTestServer'
member.returns: true if there was already an override for this path/name combination, false if not. The last call to AddOverride wins!

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.AddOverrides(System.String[0:,0:])
member.summary: Add multiple overrides in one batch. The last call to AddOverride wins!
member.param: Multi-dimensional array of overrides: (("path", "key", "val"),("path2", "key2", "val2"), etc)
member.returns: True if there was already an override for one of the path/name combinations, false if not.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.GetAllOverrides
member.summary: Get all overrides added to config as multi-dimensional string array.
member.returns: string multi-dimensional array: (("path/to/key", "name", "value"),("path/to/key", "name2", "value2"))

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.RemoveAllOverrides
member.summary: Remove all overrides that have been set for config values. Remember that this is not retroactive for values that have already been read by business logic code.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.RemoveOverride(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove one override. If not found, nothing happens

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.SetConfigFile(System.String)
member.summary: Set the name of the .config file that NetServer is to use from now on. Previously read items will still be retained; new lookups will come from here.
member.remarks: This method should be used before proper NetServer startup/authentication. As with the method, it updates internal structures, but does not flush already-read configuration information (which of course influence things like assmelby loading etc; no way we could retroactively change those).

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.GetNVCFromGoofyConfig(System.Object)
member.summary: "For some wacky reason" - quote from the net - ConfigurationManager.GetSection will return a NameValueCollection, while Configuration.GetSection will not; it will instead return a DefaultSection with the data essentially locked-in. Here we handle that, and make it into a NameValueCollection on our own.

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.GetConfig(System.String)
member.summary: Read a section of the config file, apply overrides and return the set of name/value pairs
member.param: Section path, such as "SuperOffice/Data/Explicit"
member.returns: Collection of name/value, including overrides

member.name: M:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.GetConfig(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read a section of the config file, optionally apply overrides and return the set of name/value pairs
member.param: Section path, such as "SuperOffice/Data/Explicit"
If true, then overrides will not be applied and you will get the raw file data
member.returns: Collection of name/value, including overrides

When this option is enabled, extra logging is performed. It is strongly recommended to have this option enabled during development and testing.
Huge log files are generated when this option is enabled! '

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.Diagnostics.LogLongQueries
member.summary: Should long-running queries be logged in textual form to a special file? default false

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.Diagnostics.LongQueryThreshold
member.summary: Threshold for logging a long-running query, in milliseconds. Queries that execute in less than this time are not logged as long-running. The time is from the moment the SQL text is sent to the database, until the first row (for a select) or the 'nn rows affected' return value is received.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.Diagnostics.LogLongQueriesAsXML

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.Sync
member.summary: Configuration values related to SuperOffice Sync (i.e. qSoSync).

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.Sync.SettingsSlidingExpiration
member.summary: Settings related to synchronization are configured using the SoSyncAdmin client, stored in the SuperOffice database and internally in SoSync held in a cache. This cache has two time-out values. One of the values are related to the absolute expiry time after the value is inserted in the cache and the second relates to the expiry time since the value was last used. This configuration value address the latter and refers to time since last used. 300 seconds is default value.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.Sync.SettingsAbsoluteExpiration
member.summary: Settings related to synchronization are configured using the SoSyncAdmin client, stored in the SuperOffice database and internally in SoSync held in a cache. This cache has two time-out values. One of the values are related to the absolute expiry time after the value is inserted in the cache and the second relates to the expiry time since the value was last used. This configuration value address the first related to time since read from the database. 900 seconds is default value.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService
member.summary: Configuration values for the Windows batch task service (SoBatchService)

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.ServiceName
member.summary: Returns the name of the service. This name is the one used to install the service under the service control manager in windows. If you want more than one of this service installed on the same machine, this setting must be unique for each service.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.MaxTasks
member.summary: Maximum number of tasks to spawn simultaneously.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.CPUThreshold
member.summary: CPU Threshold value in percentage. This value is used to check the computer's cpu load when spawning a new task. If the total cpu usage is above this value, no more tasks will be started even though max tasks has not been reached.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.PollingInterval
member.summary: Returns the number of seconds to sleep between each time the service checks for new tasks.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.DiagnosticsWebUri
member.summary: Returns the url that the machine should bind against when starting the http monitor utility that displays the current state and log in a browser.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.ImpersonateReporterPlugin
member.summary: Returns true/false if the batch service should impersonate the reporter executor with the document identity.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.ReporterPath
member.summary: Returns the path to the reporter executer file. This can be left blank to try the default paths. If the batch service is located in the default location (same location as CRM.Web), there should be no need to change this value. Also note that CRM.Web has a similar field in it's configuration. This specific configuration field should only be used when CRM.Web and the Batch Service are located on different machines.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.TaskTimeout
member.summary: Returns the timeout in seconds for spawned tasks. -1 is infinity.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.BatchService.RunTasksInProcess
member.summary: Set this property to true if batch tasks should be run inprocess (as an asynchron operation) or if it should run under the batch service. Default value is false.

member.name: T:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.IntellisyncConnector
member.summary: Configuration values for SoIntellisyncConnector

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.IntellisyncConnector.SessionTimeout
member.summary: Intellisync Server authenticates against Intellisync Connector. When an Intellisync Server sync session for a particular user is ended, the authentication session is always removed. When a synchronization session exceeds the this time-out, an error is returned to Intellisync Server. Intellisync Server will then try to re synchronize later. Extensive traffic in the database resulting in a slowed up synchronization will typically trigger this. Synchronization for a normal user will seldom take more than 5 minutes (300 seconds), hence the default value of 10 minutes (600 seconds) is a rather conservative value. Situations where a lot of database locks are occurring should probably result in this default value being decreased, rather than increased. Extremely slow hardware as a result of virtualization should probably result in an increased value.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.IntellisyncConnector.IntellisyncConnectorUri
member.summary: The end point hosted by SoConnectorService used by Intellisync Server for communicant. See and prefix for further reference. Default value is http://*:8000/.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.IntellisyncConnector.EnableDiagnosticsWeb
member.summary: True to make SoIntellisyncConnector host an internal web server enabling the possibility to analyze the current activity of SoIntellisyncConnector. The Uri listened on is described by . Default value is false.

member.name: P:SuperOffice.Configuration.ConfigFile.IntellisyncConnector.DiagnosticsWebUri
member.summary: The end-point used by the SoIntellisyncConnector internal diagnostics web server. must be true for the diagnostics web server to be hosted. Default value is http://*:8001/.

member.summary:
'You are about to delete the status $name. 
This status is used in one or more
Dynamic Selections, Reports or other stored queries, and will be permanently deleted
from all these contexts.

The status definition itself can be restored later,
but its use in these contexts must be restored manually.

Do you wish to delete this status?'
- Confirmation dialog. Text length can be anything, but try to keep the line length reasonable for display.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_ADMIN_STATS_TEASER
member.summary: 'Please send ANONYMOUS database usage statistics to SuperOffice - iPod draw every 6 months!'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_ADMIN_STATS_TOOLTIP
member.summary:
'Statistics include counters for dialogs and windows,
counters for shortcut keys, functions and tasks.

The data cannot be traced to individual users, and no actual data is sent, only counters.

Statistics data give SuperOffice extremely valuable input on how the product is used in practice.

Data are sent as an e-mail with a zipped attachment. You may inspect the file before sending it.

We give an Apple iPod as a prize every 6 months to a random sender of usage statistics.
Please send us your statistics once or twice per year!'
- Tooltip that explains the usage statistics transmission. Text can be any length, but you must control line breaking yourself.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_ADMIN_SYSTEM_FREETEXT_SWCHANGEMSG
member.summary:

Indexing of new data takes effect from the next login,

member.summary:
'You can set a limit on the age of follow-ups you want in the Travel Area.
The limit is specified in days, and is applied during prototype generation.
It only affects follow-ups (of all types) and documents.
0 means 'no age limit'.
'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_AREADEF_NAMEUNIQUE
member.summary: 'Area name must be unique. Please change the name, or Cancel and \nselect Edit in the Area list to edit an existing Area definition.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_AREADEF_NO0USER
member.summary:
'An Area needs to contain at least one associate with the User level 0 role, or a Remote Travel licence. \nIf it doesn't, then it will be impossible to send/receive updates to/from a database generated from the Area.\nDo you want to edit an associate's rights now? If you answer No, you will be returned to the Area Definition dialog and can continue to edit it.'
- this is a Yes/No query message box that may appear on exit from the area definition dialog

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_AREADEF_NO0USER2
member.summary:
'An area needs to contain at least one associate belonging to the User level 0 role, or who has a Remote Travel licence. 
If it doesn't, then it will be impossible to send/receive updates to/from a database generated from this area.
At present, this area can only be used for standard Travel.
Do you want to continue editing the Area Definition (recommended)?
If you have just issued users with licences,
this will not appear here until Admin is restarted.'
- this message is an alternative to the previous one, we don't know which one will make it into the release. Please translate this as well!

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_AREADEF_NOCENTRALADMIN
member.summary:
'WARNING: You have assigned all Administrator Users to areas.
This may prevent you from being able to administrate the central database!
We recommend you leave at least one Administrator User unassigned to any area.
Would you like to continue editing the Area?
If you have just issued users with licences,
this will not appear here until Admin is restarted.'
- this message appears after editing an area, if there are no level-0 users left in the central database

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_DB_CONFIRMIMPORT
member.summary:
'Current database:
- Version: %s
- Source: %s
- Owner: %s (%s)

File %s:
- Version: %s
- Owner: %s (%s)
- Contacts: %d
- File created by %s on %s

Do you really wish to DELETE the current database, and replace it with the contents of the file?'
- Confirmation message box. Parameters: SuperOffice version, ODBC data source, database owner, owner name, import version, database owner, name, no. of contacts, person name, date.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_DB_FILEEXISTS
member.summary:
'The file %s already exists.\nIt contains a copy of the %s database, created by %s on %s.\nDo you wish to overwrite it with new data?'
- Confirmation message box with several parameters: License owner name, person name, date. Length is unimportant.

member.summary: 'This database is not a valid database for upgrading to SuperOffice CRM ver 7.0.\nOnly central and satellite databases can be upgraded.\nYou cannot upgrade Travel or prototype databases.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_LOGIN_LICENCE_EXPIRY
member.summary:
'Your SuperOffice CRM licence will expire in %d day(s) if you do not enter a valid keycode.

Once the licence has expired, you will not be able to make changes to the information in SuperOffice CRM.

Contact your local SuperOffice office to renew the licence.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_LOGIN_LICENCE_UPGRADE_EXPIRY
member.summary:
'Your SuperOffice CRM licence will expire in %d day(s) if you do not enter a valid keycode.

Once the licence has expired, you will not be able to make changes to the information in SuperOffice CRM.

The reason that you need to enter a new keycode is that a major upgrade has just been performed on your system.

Contact your local SuperOffice office to get a new keycode for this version.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_LOGIN_LICENCE_UPGRADE_TO_61_EXPIRY
member.summary:
'Your SuperOffice 6.1 licence will expire in %d day(s) if you do not enter a valid key code.

Once the licence has expired, you will not be able to make changes to the information in SuperOffice 6.1.

The reason that you need to enter a new key code is that a major upgrade has just been performed on your system.

Please contact SuperOffice in order to receive a new key code for your installation.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_LOGIN_USERID
member.summary:

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_MM_ACTIVITIES_MOVED_AFTER_DATE_RESULT
member.summary:
'Activities starting after $date will be moved.'
- $date is a placeholder that SoCRM will replace, do not translate such placeholders; move them around in the translation if needed to suit the grammar

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_MM_ACTIVITIES_MOVED_AFTER_DATE_RESULT_MERGE_PERSON
member.summary:
'$sourceContactNameAndCompany activities starting after $date will be moved'
- $sourceContactNameAndCompany and $date are placeholder that SoCRM will replace, do not translate such placeholders; move them around in the translation if needed to suit the grammar

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_MM_ACTIVITIES_MOVED_RESULT_MERGE_PERSON
member.summary:
'$sourceContactNameAndCompany activities will be moved'
- $sourceContactNameAndCompany is a placeholder that SoCRM will replace, do not translate such placeholders; move them around in the translation if needed to suit the grammar

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_MM_ACTIVITIES_MOVED_RESULT_MOVE_PERSON
member.summary:
'All activities registered on $sourceContactName will be moved to $destinationCompanyNameAndDepartment'
- $sourceContactName and $destinationCompanyNameAndDepartment are placeholder that SoCRM will replace, do not translate such placeholders; move them around in the translation if needed to suit the grammar

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_MM_ACTIVITIES_NOT_MOVED_RESULT_MERGE_PERSON
member.summary:
'$sourceContactNameAndCompany activities will not be moved'
- $sourceContactNameAndCompany is a placeholder that SoCRM will replace, do not translate such placeholders; move them around in the translation if needed to suit the grammar

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_MM_ACTIVITIES_NOT_MOVED_RESULT_MOVE_PERSON

member.summary: 'Are you sure you want to delete Satellite %s?'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_QUERY_DELETE_SATELLITE_PRMT2
member.summary:
'WARNING: Once you delete a Satellite, you can no longer 
exchange information between the Central database
and the Satellite. Any changes to it made after this point will be irrevocably lost.
You should ensure that you have updated the central database with the latest changes 
from the Satellite and made it unavailable to its users
before you delete it.
Do you want to ABORT this operation now (there is no 'UNDO' after this)?'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_QUERY_EXIT_PROMPT
member.summary: 'You have an unfinished import job.\n\nDo you really want to stop it?'

member.summary: 'Are you sure you want to regenerate Satellite %s (%s)?'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_QUERY_REGEN_SATELLITE_PRMT2
member.summary:
'WARNING: Once you regenerate a Satellite, you 
can no longer exchange information between the Central database
and the old (existing) Satellite. Any changes to it 
made after this point will be irrevocably lost.
You should ensure that you have read in the final 
update from the Satellite and made it unavailable to its users
before you complete the regeneration.
Do you want to ABORT this operation now (there is no 'UNDO' after this)?'

On Sybase Enterprise the password must usually be 6 characters, but SuperOffice has no way
to actually determine this, and there may be other restrictions (reserved words, digits, etc.).
Please enter a new password and try again, or consult the documentation for your database.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_SCRIPT_WARNING
member.summary:
'Scripting is a powerful tool, opening up enormous possibilities, but it can also have unforeseen, and occasionally seriously detrimental, consequences. Scripts can contain commands that, like viruses, can delete data from your database. Careless use of scripts and scripts in combination can have undesired effects and, in the worst cases, lead to the loss of critical data. It is essential that you employ sound routines for determining who can maintain, edit and add new scripts to the system.\nIn order to be certain that you have understood these potential problems, we ask you to confirm that you have read and understood this warning.'
- Dialog box text. No formatting. PLEASE OBSERVE: Simply using the CR key is prohibited and BUILD BREAKER. You must inline them.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_SELECTION_TASK_COPY_INTO_SELECTION_TOOLTIP
member.summary:
'This task lets you add selection members to a different existing selection or to a new selection.
Members of a Dynamic selection can be added to a Static selection.
A Dynamic selection can be copied to a new Dynamic selection.
A Static selection can never be transferred to a Dynamic one.'
- Tooltip text used on selection task button for copying members into a new/existing selection.

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_SETUP_CHOOSE_LOCATION_INFO
member.summary: 'The program folder is where all the SuperOffice files are installed. To install into a different folder, click Browse, and select another folder.\n\nThe document archive is where SuperOffice documents are stored. We strongly recommend that you enter this path in UNC syntax if the clients will be using SuperOffice Travel, e.g. \\\\Server1\\SO_ARC. In that case, the folder where SO_ARC is installed must exist and be shared. Alternatively a normal path can be used, and changed in SuperOffice.ini after the installation.'

member.summary: 'Select update of standard reports'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_SETUP_CHOOSE_STDREPORTS_UPDATE_INFO
member.summary: 'During update of $version you can choose if you want to update all standard reports, or only import the new ones. If you choose to update all, the existing standard report templates will be overwritten and changes made to the standard reports will disappear or be overwritten. The standard reports will not be updated if you select to not update the database. Using the program SoRepImp.exe, all or selected standard reports can be updated after update of $version. If you want to decide later whether to update the existing standard reports, uncheck the box and only the new standard reports will be imported at this time.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_SETUP_CHOOSE_STDREPORTS_UPGRADE
member.summary: 'Select upgrade of standard reports'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_SETUP_CHOOSE_STDREPORTS_UPGRADE_INFO
member.summary: 'During upgrade to $version you can choose if you want to upgrade all standard reports, or only import the new ones. If you choose to upgrade all, the existing standard reports will be overwritten and changes made since installation will disappear. Using the program SoRepImp.exe, all or selected standard reports can be updated after upgrade to $version. If you want to decide later whether to upgrade the existing standard reports, uncheck the box and only the new reports will be imported at this time.'

member.summary:

The document archive is where SuperOffice documents are stored. This folder cannot be changed here.
If you want to change the document archive location, move it manually. Then use SoCreateMST.exe to change the path in the client installers for each language, so that it will be correct when the users install.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_SETUP_TARGET_DATABASE_INFO
member.summary:
'In order to install/upgrade $product correctly, the program needs information about the user name, password, prefix and encoding for the destination database.

If the preferred destination database for the new installation is not shown under "Select ODBC data source", you can click "Create new ODBC source" to create a pointer to the database required. For updates and upgrades, you cannot select a database; the one listed in SuperOffice.ini will be used.

When upgrading, a new destination database must also be selected; the old database will be read but not changed.

The user name and password are the database administrator's. Prefix is the name of the database user who owns the tables. Encoding decides how text is written to the database and which languages you can use.'
- Do not translate "$product"

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_SETUP_TARGET_DATABASE_INFO_7
member.summary:
'In order to install/upgrade $product correctly, the program needs information about the user name, password, prefix and encoding for the destination database.

If the preferred destination database for the new installation is not shown under "Select ODBC data source", you can click "Create new ODBC source" to create a pointer to the database required. For updates and upgrades, you cannot select a database; the one listed in SuperOffice.ini will be used.

When upgrading, a new destination database must also be selected; the old database will be read but not changed.

The user name and password are the database administrator's. Prefix is the name of the database user who owns the tables. Encoding decides how text is written to the database and which languages you can use.'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_TRADB_FILEREAD
member.summary: 'This update file (%s) has already been read and cannot be read again.\nThis error indicates problems with the database and/or record of updates from this traveller.\nThe traveller should come home (central update) as soon as possible, or data loss may occur!'

member.name: F:SuperOffice.Globalization.RC.SR_TRADB_MISSINGASH
member.summary:
'An .ASH file (%s) required to read in the update is missing. This will block further reading of updates from this traveller.
If possible, the traveller should come home (central update) as soon as possible!

If that is not possible, the database must be patched by the system supervisor to allow 
re-reading of the (earlier) update that had the same number as the currently missing .ASH file.
An attempt may then be made to read the current update, though this may be impossible if other errors also exist.'

member.returns: Array of plug-in instances.
